qas.question: How long has the Strumica Carnival been going on?
Who ran from house to house, laughing, screaming, and singing?
What day is the main Carnival Night observed on?
What year was the Festival of Caricatures and Aphorisms added to Strumica's Carnival celebrations?

context: The Strumica Carnival (Macedonian: Струмички Карневал, translated Strumichki Karneval) has been held <a0_0>since at least 1670<a0_0/>, when the <a1_0>Turkish<a1_0/> author Evlija Chelebija wrote while staying there, "I came into a town located in the foothills of a high hillock and what I saw that night was <a2_0>masked people<a2_0/> running house–to–house, with laughter, scream and song." The Carnival took an organized form in 1991; in 1994, Strumica became a member of FECC and in 1998 hosted the XVIII International Congress of Carnival Cities. The Strumica Carnival opens on a Saturday night at a masked ball where the Prince and Princess are chosen; the main Carnival night is on <a3_0>Tuesday<a3_0/>, when masked participants (including groups from abroad) compete in various subjects. As of <a4_0>2000<a4_0/>, the Festival of Caricatures and Aphorisms has been held as part of Strumica's Carnival celebrations.
